title.narrative: Generating Sustainable Livelihoods Throughout Rehabilitating Irrigation ‎Infrastructure and Supporting Supplemental Irrigation in NW of Syria

description.narrative: The project will perform light rehabilitation to irrigation canals and irrigation system in Afrin ‎district ‎which suffer from severity and food insecurity.‎ ‎ The project will provide full access to irrigation water throughout cleaning 63.3 Km of main, ‎sub-main ‎and secondary irrigation canals, 33.3 Km of cleaning work will be implemented via ‎Cash for Work ‎modality to create 60 job opportunities for host community and internal ‎displaced unskilled labor. ‎ ‎ Light rehabilitation to infrastructure of an irrigation scheme in Afrin will be achieved by ‎repairing three ‎water pumps, irrigation network, electricity network and conducting premise ‎rehabilitation for Afrin ‎water pump station which has been damaged under the conflict during ‎Syrian crisis.‎ ‎ Project components have been designed to achieve cost efficiency use of the project ‎resources and ‎maximum impact for the vulnerable beneficiaries by supporting public irrigation ‎projects and using the ‎available electricity to operate water pumps in purpose to minimize ‎irrigation running costs, in addition ‎to improve capacity of the targeted communities to sustain ‎households’ livelihood, and to support food ‎availability through longer-term interventions to ‎respond to high vulnerability level of a large part of ‎the population living in the targeted ‎communities ‎ more than 5000 HHs working in agriculture as the main income and food resource will be ‎enabled to ‎irrigate 19,730 hectares of Afrin plain planted with wheat, trees and other crops.. ‎ Furthermore, the project will support wheat and other crops farmers HHs from vulnerable ‎communities ‎in Afrin, and southern east part of Arrouj plains with 100 mm of irrigation water ‎provided in one ‎supplemental irrigation to survive about 80% their crops from any potential ‎drought wave and reaching ‎to ripening stage and increasing the production 50%.‎ ‎ Selecting beneficiaries of CFW activity will be based on need and vulnerability with special ‎‎consideration to IDPs, HHs headed by women and/or disabled people. The project will assist and contribute to the protection of the most vulnerable groups of women, ‎men, ‎girls and boys in all age groups and disabled people in the targeted communities. Beneficiaries have been involved in project designing and implementation through the close ‎‎coordination with local councils and communities representatives, beneficiaries will be ‎engaged in ‎evaluation through satisfaction survey and complaint mechanism as well.‎
